tit.cmt: 原文表記に基づき、Masanari→Masashigeに修正

sen.j: 野々村 正成（ののむら まさしげ、生年不詳 - 天正10年6月2日 (旧暦)（1582年6月21日）？）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Masanari NONOMURA (date of birth unknown - June 21, 1582?) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Masashige NONOMURA (year of birth unknown - July 1, 1582?) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: Masanari→Masashigeに修正、統一リストに基づき、date of birth→year of birthに修正、ユリウス→グレゴリオ暦に修正
sen.e: Masashige NONOMURA (year of birth unknown - July 1, 1582?) was Busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
He was a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.
He was a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.
He was a vassal of Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: 織田信忠に従って本能寺の変で討死した。
sen.e: Masanari died at the Honnoji Incident following Nobutada ODA.
Masashige died at the Honno-ji Incident following Nobutada ODA.
sen.cmt: Masanari→Masashigeに修正、the Honno-ji Incidentとしました。
sen.e: Masashige died at the Honno-ji Incident following Nobutada ODA.

sen.j: 別名は正利、幸久、通称三十郎。
sen.e: His aliases were Masatoshi and Yukihisa, and his common name was Sanjuro.
His aliases were Masatoshi and Yukihisa, and his common name was Sanjuro.
His aliases were Masatoshi and Yukihisa, and his common name was Sanjuro.

sen.j: 弟に野々村幸成（吉安）、野々村豊前守。
sen.e: His younger brother was Yukinari NONOMURA (Yoshiyasu), NONOMURA Buzen no kami.
His younger brothers were Yukinari (Yoshiyasu) NONOMURA, NONOMURA Buzen no kami.
sen.cmt: younger brother was→younger brothers wereに修正、(Yoshiyasu)の位置を移動
sen.e: His younger brothers were Yukinari (Yoshiyasu) NONOMURA, NONOMURA Buzen no kami.

sen.j: 美濃国の出身で、初め斎藤氏に仕え、永禄5年（1562年）5月の軽海の戦いでは、織田信長配下の織田信益を討ち取ったという。
sen.e: It is said that Masanari was from Mino Province, served the Saito clan first, and killed Nobumasu ODA under the command of Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Karumi in May 1562.
It is said that Masashige was from Mino Province, served the Saito clan first, and killed Nobumasu ODA under the command of Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Karumi in June 1562.
sen.cmt: Masanari→Masashigeに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正
sen.e: It is said that Masashige was from Mino Province, served the Saito clan first, and killed Nobumasu ODA under the command of Nobunaga ODA in the Battle of Karumi in June 1562.

sen.j: その後信長に仕え、馬廻りとされた。
sen.e: Later, he served Nobunaga as Oumamawari (horse guards).
Later, he served Nobunaga as Umamawari (horse guards).
Later, he served Nobunaga as Umamawari (horse guards).

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）3月の長篠の戦いでは、前田利家、佐々成政、福富秀勝と共に鉄砲隊を指揮した。
sen.e: In March 1575, Masanari led the firearms troop together with Toshiie MAEDA, Narimasa SASSA, and Hidekatsu FUKUTOMI in the Battle of Nagashino.
In April 1575, Masashige led the firearms troop together with Toshiie MAEDA, Narimasa SASSA, and Hidekatsu FUKUTOMI in the Battle of Nagashino.
sen.cmt: Masanari→Masashigeに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正
sen.e: In April 1575, Masashige led the firearms troop together with Toshiie MAEDA, Narimasa SASSA, and Hidekatsu FUKUTOMI in the Battle of Nagashino.

sen.j: 天正6年（1578年）11月の摂津国有岡城攻め（有岡城の戦い）にも参加、中川清秀の投降を信長に仲介した。
sen.e: In November 1578, he also joined the attack on Arioka-jo Castle in Settsu Province (the battle of Arioka-jo Castle), and intermediated the surrender of Kiyohide NAKAGAWA to Nobunaga.
In December 1578, he also joined the attack on Arioka-jo Castle in Settsu Province (the battle of Arioka-jo Castle), and intermediated the surrender of Kiyohide NAKAGAWA to Nobunaga.
In December 1578, he also joined the attack on Arioka-jo Castle in Settsu Province (the battle of Arioka-jo Castle), and intermediated the surrender of Kiyohide NAKAGAWA to Nobunaga.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）2月には紀伊国方面に派遣され、土橋攻めの検使を務め、更に顕如や根来寺、粉河寺へ信長の朱印状を伝達している。
sen.e: In February 1582, he was dispatched in a direction toward Kii Province and served as Kenshi (inspector) in the attack on TSUCHIBASHI clan, and moreover, transmitted Nobunaga's Shuinjo (a license for foreign trade) to Kennyo, Negoro-ji Temple, and Kokawa-dera Temple.

In March 1582, he was dispatched in a direction toward Kii Province and served as Kenshi (inspector) in the attack on the Tsuchibashi clan, and moreover, transmitted Nobunaga's Shuinjo (a license for foreign trade) to Kennyo, Negoro-ji Temple, and Kokawa-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正、TSUCHIBASHI clan→the Tsuchibashi clanに修正
sen.e: In March 1582, he was dispatched in a direction toward Kii Province and served as Kenshi (inspector) in the attack on the Tsuchibashi clan, and moreover, transmitted Nobunaga's Shuinjo (a license for foreign trade) to Kennyo, Negoro-ji Temple, and Kokawa-dera Temple.

sen.j: 同年6月2日の本能寺の変では、二条城で織田信忠に従って戦い、討死した。
sen.e: In the Honnoji Incident on June 2 of the same year, Masanari fought following Nobutada ODA in Nijo-jo Castle and was killed in the battle.
In the Honno-ji Incident on July 1 of the same year, Masashige fought following Nobutada ODA in Nijo-jo Castle and was killed in the battle.
sen.cmt: Masanari→Masashigeに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正、the Honno-ji Incidentとしました。
sen.e: In the Honno-ji Incident on July 1 of the same year, Masashige fought following Nobutada ODA in Nijo-jo Castle and was killed in the battle.

sen.j: また、天正12年（1584年）9月、佐々成政の能登国末森城 (能登国)攻めに従軍して討死したとの説もあるが、これは野々村主水正という者で別人。
sen.e: Moreover, one theory says that he joined the attack on Suemori-jo Castle in Noto Province by Narimasa SASSA and was killed there, but this was a different person called NONOMURA mondo no sho.

Moreover, one theory says that he joined the attack on Suemori-jo Castle in Noto Province by Narimasa SASSA and was killed there in October 1584, but this was a different person called NONOMURA Mondo no sho.
sen.cmt: 「天正12年（1584年）9月」→訳漏れのため訳出、Mondo no shoとしました。
sen.e: Moreover, one theory says that he joined the attack on Suemori-jo Castle in Noto Province by Narimasa SASSA and was killed there in October 1584, but this was a different person called NONOMURA Mondo no sho.
